5)Urban and Rural Small Biz Success: 
#SmallBiz owners in urban and rural settings have a lot in common but face some different challenges. @SBAgov & Congress must work to provide urban/rural small businesses with tools they need to overcome challenges based on geography.

4)Diversity: 
#SmallBizBigIdeas come from all types of ppl. Diversity in type & ownership of #SmallBusiness is vital to economic growth. Congress must ensure veteran, minority and woman (just to name a few) #SmallBiz owners don't face disproportionate barriers to entry/growth.

3)An Able Workforce: 
A successful #SmallBiz needs an able workforce. Congress can help by investing in all forms of education (inc. #VoTech), reducing barriers to attaining/paying for school & giving employees predictability in personal finances so they can plan for the future.

2)Congress Must Help with Access to Capital: 
The bad news is that new tax law disproportionately favors big businesses over #SmallBiz when it comes to tax relief.  The good news is that members from both sides of the aisle & @SBAgov are working on ways to improve access.

1)Congress Must Get Behind Small Businesses: 
In every district and every state, #SmallBIz sparks innovation, creates jobs and reinvests into local communities. D's & R's understand this. In the Senate, members of the #SmallBusiness Committee want to see small businesses grow.

When I came to the Senate, I asked to serve on the #SmallBusiness Committee because it has always been clear that small businesses are the growth engines of our economy. Today, I spoke to @BobCusack re. #SmallBizBigIdeas at an event hosted by @TheHillEvents.
